data.Title: Google August 2024 Core Update: Gains Reversing, Impact on AI Overviews
data.Description: Google's August 2024 core update, released on August 15th, is showing signs of volatility with initial ranking gains vanishing or reversing for some websites.  There are also reports that Google's AI Overviews, a new search feature, are being impacted by the core update, with sites surging or dropping in visibility within the AI Overviews section. Google advises waiting until the core update is fully rolled out before assessing its full impact.

data.Title: Google Search Console: Understanding "Discovered - Currently Not Indexed" Status
data.Description: Google Search Console's "Discovered - Currently Not Indexed" status indicates that Google is aware of a webpage's existence but has chosen not to index it. Google's Martin Splitt explains that this status doesn't necessarily mean the page is low quality.  Reasons for this status include the page being too new, low word count, already having a canonical version indexed, or Googlebot being unable to crawl it due to server issues.

data.Title: Unanswered Comments Don't Impact Google Search Rankings
data.Description: Contrary to some SEO beliefs, Google's Martin Splitt confirms that having unanswered comments on a webpage does not negatively affect its search ranking. Google Search does not consider whether comments receive responses as a ranking factor.

data.Title: Google Tests Blue Verification Icons in Organic Search Results
data.Description: Google is experimenting with blue verification icons within the free organic search results. This move aims to help users identify authentic and authoritative sources.

data.Title: Google Ads Bug Misattributes Traffic, Promises Credits to Advertisers
data.Description: A recent bug in Google Ads incorrectly attributed traffic to "smart matching," a feature that doesn't exist. Google acknowledges the error and is working to credit affected advertisers.

data.Title: Perplexity AI Search Engine to Introduce Ads in Q4 2024
data.Description: Perplexity, an AI-powered search engine, has revealed plans to launch advertising in the fourth quarter of 2024. The company's pitch deck outlines a CPM (cost per thousand impressions) model with prices exceeding $50. Advertisers will have the opportunity to sponsor "related questions" alongside search results.

data.Title: Microsoft to Release "Recall" AI Search Feature to Testers in October
data.Description: Microsoft is set to release its controversial "Recall" AI search feature to testers in October. Recall captures screenshots of on-screen activity, enabling users to search for previously viewed information. This feature has raised privacy concerns.

data.Title: Google Antitrust Ruling Sparks Debate on AI Content Use
data.Description: A recent antitrust ruling against Google has ignited debate among online publishers and SEO experts. The ruling requires Google to obtain consent from publishers before using their content for AI-generated search results, raising questions about copyright and fair use.

data.Title: Condé Nast Partners with OpenAI, Granting Access to Content for ChatGPT and SearchGPT
data.Description: Condé Nast has entered a multiyear agreement with OpenAI, allowing ChatGPT and SearchGPT to surface stories from renowned publications like The New Yorker, Vogue, Vanity Fair, Bon Appétit, and Wired. This partnership highlights the growing trend of AI companies seeking access to high-quality content.

data.Title: Google Introduces "Google-CloudVertexBot" Crawler for Vertex AI Agents
data.Description: Google has launched a new web crawler, "Google-CloudVertexBot," designed to crawl websites at the request of site owners for building Vertex AI Agents. This crawler, identifiable by its user agent substring, signals Google's ongoing efforts to enhance its AI capabilities.

data.Title: Meta Launches New Web Crawler for AI Model Data Collection
data.Description: Meta has deployed a new web crawler to gather more data from the open web, aiming to improve its AI models. This move has sparked privacy concerns, with some website owners using tools to block known scrapers.

data.Title: Google Updates Maps Design in Search Results
data.Description: Google has refreshed the design of its maps within search results, impacting local packs, knowledge panel maps, and other map integrations. The updated design aims to provide a more visually appealing and user-friendly experience.

data.Title: Google AI Overviews Show High Overlap with Organic Search Results
data.Description: A recent analysis reveals that Google's AI Overviews now heavily rely on top organic search results, with an overlap of 99%. This suggests that websites ranking well in organic search are more likely to be featured in AI Overviews.

data.Title: Google Search Ranking Bug Resolved
data.Description: Google has addressed a significant search ranking bug that emerged alongside the August core update. The bug, which lasted for over four days, has now been resolved.

data.Title: Google Merchant Center Next Migration in September
data.Description: Google is migrating all merchants to its new Google Merchant Center Next platform in September. This mandatory transition will introduce a redesigned interface and new features for managing product feeds and shopping campaigns.

data.Title: Bing Image Search Introduces Refinement Cards
data.Description: Bing Image Search now features refinement cards within its results interface. These cards provide users with refinement options for their search queries, accompanied by example photos to illustrate potential results.

data.Title: Google Search Console Data Persists After Domain Expiration
data.Description: Google has clarified that Search Console data remains accessible even after a domain expires. There is no option to reset this data, and temporarily removing the property from Search Console only hides it from view.
